page.title: 06Farming in North Radcliffe
page.content: Radcliffe is an urban area. The population has more than doubled in the last twenty years. This has meant that farmers have a tough time. Most of their land is near the expanding town and has been used for the new housing. The new housing has brought other difficulties. People,mainly children,have run through crops,broken fencing or frightened animals.The type of farming has been by tradition dairying since grass grows well in the local climate,also the towns provide a ready market for the milk produced. Some farmers in the area keep other animals such as sheep, pigs or poultry and because of the popular demand some even keep horses and run riding schools.As one farmer puts it, "Farming near a town has advantages as well as disadvantages."Some of the land is rented from Wilton Estates.
